course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Economic Development in China
course.description: This course focuses on economic reforms and development in China, especially since 1978. It will be a combination of institutional details and comprehensive empirical evidence. Basic knowledge in statistics or economics will benefit.

reviews.author: LouisLOL
reviews.comment_content: Sounds interesting, mainly focuses on economic reforms and development in China, will try to explain what prevented China from economic development, why China’s economic reform since 1978 created a rapid economic development, and what the problems are in China’s economic development.
reviews.comment_teaching: mainland background teacher, easy to understand
reviews.comment_workload:
It's just an elective course with a heavy workload.
Class discussion and participation — 10%
Assignments — 25%
Mid-term group presentation — 25%
Final term paper — 40%

Get to know Chinese Statistical Data (an exercise on Chinese data searching and analysis) and some useful empirical methodology (an exercise on dealing with [Chinese] Statistical data: basic regression and interpretation of the results): 10%; to be submitted in academic calendar week 6.
Referee report: You will write a referee report of a recent NBER working paper on Chinese economic development. The purpose of a referee report is to critically evaluate the features and bugs of a paper: 10%; to be submitted in week 9.
A two-page reading report on the main reference: 5%; to be submitted in week 12.
